problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the ABCDE shape is a rectangle where an equilateral triangle has been removed from one side of it, the perimeter of the ABCDE shape is 66 and the perimeter of the BFGC rectangle is 34, compute the length of the AB side of the ABCDE shape. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (34.23, 34.23)
B = (34.23, 21034.23)
C = (8034.23, 21034.23)
D = (8034.23, 34.23)
E = (4034.23, 6962.43)
F = (34.23, 30034.23)
G = (8034.23, 30034.23)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(6, 12))

# Draw the gray polygon (A, B, C, D, E)
gray_polygon = patches.Polygon([A, B, C, D, E], closed=True, color="gray", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(gray_polygon)

# Draw the green rectangle (B, F, G, C)
green_rectangle = patches.Polygon([B, F, G, C], closed=True, color="green", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(green_rectangle)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=0.5, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, A, B, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, B, C, D)
draw_right_angle(ax, B, F, G)
draw_right_angle(ax, F, G, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, G, C, B)
draw_right_angle(ax, C, B, F)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="top")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(G[0], G[1], "G", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((B[0] + F[0]) / 2, (B[1] + F[1]) / 2, "9", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="center")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-4965.77, 13034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965.77, 35034.23)
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The perimeter of the BFGC rectangle is 34 and the length of its BF side is 9, so the length of the BC side is $\frac{34}{2} - 9 = 17.0 - 9 = 8$. The side of the equilateral triangle in the ABCDE shape is equal to the side of the rectangle with length 8 and the shape has two rectangle sides with equal but unknown lengths, one rectangle side with length 8, and two triangle sides with length 8. The perimeter of the shape is 66 so $2 * OtherSide + 3 * 8 = 66$. So $2 * OtherSide = 66 - 24 = 42$ and the length of the AB side is $\frac{42}{2} = 21$. Therefore the final answer is 21.
